How to Install sass-elisp on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • sass-elisp

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install sass-elisp on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing sass-elisp on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall sass-elisp in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install sass-elisp, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install sass-elisp Using apt

To install sass-elisp in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install sass-elisp using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install sass-elisp

The installation of sass-elisp might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install sass-elisp Using apt-get

To install sass-elisp using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install sass-elisp.

sudo apt-get -y install sass-elisp

Install sass-elisp Using Synaptic

To install sass-elisp using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install sass-elisp on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for sass-elisp. This will display the sass-elisp package in the package window, now to install sass-elisp, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the sass-elisp package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of sass-elisp.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install sass-elisp Using aptitude

To install sass-elisp on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of sass-elisp.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install sass-elisp using the command aptitude install sass-elisp.

sudo aptitude -y install sass-elisp

How to Upgrade sass-elisp on debian

If you want to upgrade the sass-elisp package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade sass-elisp using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade sass-elisp to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade sass-elisp.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade sass-elisp sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade sass-elisp

Upgrade sass-elisp using Aptitude

To upgrade sass-elisp using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade sass-elisp.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade sass-elisp

Upgrade sass-elisp using Synaptic

To upgrade sass-elisp using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for sass-elisp, now right-click sass-elisp, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade sass-elisp just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall sass-elisp on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall sass-elisp from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just sass-elisp, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove sass-elisp

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of sass-elisp

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of sass-elisp you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge sass-elisp

Remove sass-elisp using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall sass-elisp using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for sass-elisp, right-click the sass-elisp package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall sass-elisp click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install sass-elisp on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade sass-elisp using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of sass-elisp then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
